comments.author: Nancy
comments.content:
Michael,

I'll definitely try the fava beans with fried pita. Do you have any Tanzanian recipes? I'll be traveling there in the fall and would like to prepare my taste buds! I've found East African recipes, but not too much luck with Tanzania.

Thanks a lot, Nancy

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I wish I did! Totally ignorant of Tanzanian food.

comments.author: Jamie | Thrifty Veggie Mama
comments.content: This looks so amazing.  I don't use fava beans nearly enough

comments.author: Thomas Rumsfeld
comments.content: Great recipe!! I tried to do it this weekend, It definitely didn't look as the one in the picture, but it tasted delicious!!

comments.author: Shelley @ Two Healthy Kitchens
comments.content: Always good to know that I'm not the only one whose late-night snacks border on good-sized meals! :D And, yes - this would be excellent late-night noshing. In truth, I'd be overjoyed to eat this anytime, breakfast included! Amazing combination of flavors - just gorgeous! Lucky me - I have some stale pita bread and a zucchini in my fridge at this very moment!

comments.author: Briana Collier
comments.content: I'm definitely going to try this recipe! I love zucchini!

comments.author: Anne Campbell
comments.content: Tried this over the weekend, and it was FABULOUS. I used chickpeas, and instead of plain water, I used about half a cup of tomato water that I had on hand from draining some chopped, roasted fresh tomatoes. The extra tomato flavor married everything together. What a great quick dinner!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I love your additions, they sound perfect!

comments.author: Christina Morales
comments.content:
I love this Fava Beans and Zucchini. Looks very yummy to taste. thanks for sharing.

Christina Morales
http://indonesiancuisinerecipes.com

comments.author: Alissa
comments.content: I've been itching to make this since you first posted the recipe. Finally got around to it tonight and it was amazing! The dish came together really quickly and was incredibly satisfying. I'll definitely be making this again. Thanks so much!

comments.author: Ellen Walker
comments.content: Michael,  Love the fact that you mentioned Basson Bakery pita! My husband owns the bakery and I thought I had tried every way possible to prepare pita.  You gave me a new idea!  Kudos to you.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Well that's pretty cool! If you try it, let me know what you think.
